DOCNAME: CASE OF YAGTZILAR AND OTHERS v. GREECE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 regarding the right of access to court;Violation of Art. 6-1 regarding the length of proceedings;Violation of P1-1
TEXT: CARDINAL . In DATE the NORP State occupied an olive grove of a total area of CARDINAL sq . m in LOC ( northern GPE ) and assigned it to ORG Relief Committee ( PERSON ) with a view to settling refugees from LOC Minor there following the mandatory exchange of populations with GPE under LAW . The land was occupied without any compensation being paid to the owners of the olive grove , of whom the applicants are the heirs . The basis for the occupation was a government ordinance of DATE authorising the expropriation and occupation of land before any compensation was paid to its owners . The ordinance was subsequently ratified by a constitutional resolution of CARDINAL DATE ; its content was also incorporated into LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE , by decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG ( PERSON ) , ORG expropriated the land in question .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an application with the appropriate courts for compensation owed them by the ORG , which had in the meantime taken over from ORG . Following that application the following judgments , among others , were delivered :
( i ) interlocutory decision ( προδικαστική ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG of First Instance ordering a number of expert assessments ;

( ii ) NORP final decision no . CARDINAL of ORG of First Instance assessing the final unit amount of compensation at CARDINAL drachmas ( GRD ) per square metre ; the parties appealed against that decision ;
( iii ) interlocutory judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG of Appeal setting aside the decision and ordering the parties to produce supplementary evidence ;
( iv ) decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of the President of ORG of First Instance recognising that the applicants were entitled to the compensation assessed ;
( v ) judgment no . CARDINAL of ORG of Appeal quashing judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and ordering the case to be remitted to ORG of First Instance ;

( vi ) decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG of First Instance assessing the final unit amount of compensation at GRD CARDINAL,CARDINAL per square metre ; the parties appealed against that decision , but the hearing was not held until DATE ; in the meantime , on DATE , the applicants had lodged a further application with ORG for an assessment of the compensation amount ;

( vii ) judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG of Appeal ordering a fresh expert assessment , which was begun in DATE and completed in DATE ; at a hearing on CARDINAL DATE the applicants claimed GRD CARDINAL,CARDINAL per square metre and the ORG raised an objection on the ground that their right to compensation had lapsed ;
( viii ) interlocutory judgment no . CARDINAL of ORG of Appeal dismissing the objection raised by the ORG and ordering the applicants to justify their assessment of the value of their land ;

( ix ) judgment no . CARDINAL of ORG of Appeal dismissing a further objection raised by the ORG that the right to compensation had lapsed and assessing the final unit amount of compensation at GRD CARDINAL,CARDINAL to GRD CARDINAL,CARDINAL per square metre ; the ORG lodged an appeal on points of law against that judgment , raising the same objection again ;

( x ) judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG of ORG , setting aside ORG judgment on procedural grounds and remitting the case to ORG ; subsequently , on DATE , the applicants lodged a fresh application with that court for a compensation amount to be assessed ;

( xi ) judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG ordering the case to be remitted to ORG of First Instance to determine the merits of the applications lodged by the applicants on DATE and CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants resumed the proceedings before ORG of First Instance . They also lodged a further application for a final unit amount of compensation to be assessed . They sought GRD CARDINAL per square metre . In its observations in reply of CARDINAL DATE , the ORG pleaded again that the applicants’ right to compensation had lapsed .

CARDINAL . A hearing was held on DATE . On CARDINAL DATE the court ordered the applicants to justify their assessment of the value of their land . On DATE the applicants requested the judge rapporteur to set a date for the hearing of witnesses . An expert assessment was also carried out .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants asked the court to set a hearing date . The hearing was held on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court decided to adjourn its examination of the case on the ground that an investigative measure ( αυτοψία ) had not been carried out ( decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants asked the court to fix a hearing date . The hearing was held on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of First Instance dismissed as unfounded the objection raised by the ORG that the applicants’ right to compensation had lapsed and determined the final unit amount of compensation at ORG CARDINAL per square metre ( decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG lodged an appeal against that decision . It again raised the same objection .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG set aside decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on the ground that the lower court had incorrectly dismissed the objection raised by the ORG that the ORG claim was statute - barred . Indeed , ORG considered that the applicants’ right to compensation had lapsed since DATE . Giving judgment on the merits , it dismissed the applicants’ application of CARDINAL DATE on the ground that as their claim was statute - barred , they no longer had locus standi ( judgment no . DATE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an appeal on points of law . In their statement of grounds of appeal they submitted that ORG had misinterpreted the facts and the constitutional and legislative provisions relating to the limitation of actions , and had wrongly assessed the evidence . They added that , in any event , the objection had already been dismissed by judgments FAC . CARDINAL and CARDINAL of ORG . The applicants stressed , lastly , that they had never received any compensation for the expropriation of their land and that the objection now raised against them contravened the principle of good faith and infringed in particular their right to peaceful enjoyment of their possessions .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , after examining all the grounds of appeal on points of law submitted by the applicants , dismissed their appeal on the ground that it was ill - founded ( judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
